title: Easily upload and manage Amazon S3 files in a Next.js web app with AWS Amplify-AWS Online Tech Talks
description:
AWS Amplify is a set of purpose-built tools and features that lets professional front-end web and mobile developers quickly build feature-rich, full-stack applications on AWS. By offering built-in best practices for common web development use cases like authentication and storage, Amplify reduces the overall steps and lines of code required for developers to build full-stack apps and bring ideas to market faster. 

In this webinar, we’ll deep dive on how to build and deploy a NextJS web app with auth and storage features, then add the Amplify StorageManager UI component to easily upload and manage your files in Amazon S3.

title: Optimize Amazon RDS and Aurora Costs with ElastiCache for Redis - AWS Databases in 15
description:
Amazon ElastiCache is a fully managed, Redis- and Memcached-compatible service delivering real-time, cost-optimized performance for modern applications. ElastiCache scales to hundreds of millions of operations per second with microsecond response time, and offers enterprise-grade security and reliability. In this session, learn about the financial advantages of caching RDS/Aurora workloads including how you can save up to 55% in cost and gain up to 80x faster read performance using ElastiCache with RDS for MySQL (vs. RDS for MySQL alone).

Learning Objectives: 
* Objective 1: Receive an introduction on the financial advantages of caching your RDS and Aurora workloads.
* Objective 2: Receive an introduction on ElastiCache implementation strategies.
* Objective 3: Watch a demo on how to easily optimize your RDS and Aurora workloads with ElastiCache to optimize costs and boost performance.

title: Getting Started with Amazon Aurora I/O-Optimized - AWS Databases in 15
description:
Amazon Aurora I/O-Optimized is a configuration for Amazon Aurora that provides improved price performance and predictable pricing for customers with I/O-intensive applications. Aurora I/O-Optimized offers improved performance, increasing throughput and reducing latency for customers’ most demanding workloads. With Aurora I/O-Optimized, there are zero charges for read and write I/O operations—you only pay for your database instances and storage usage, making it easy to predict your database spend up front. You can now choose between two configurations: Aurora Standard or Aurora I/O-Optimized. For applications with low-to-moderate I/Os, Aurora Standard is a cost-effective option. For applications with high I/Os, Aurora I/O-Optimized provides improved price performance, predictable pricing, and up to 40% costs savings. In this session, you will learn how the Aurora I/O-Optimized pricing option can help you achieve cost savings for your I/O-intensive workloads and how you can get started today.

Learning Objectives: 
* Objective 1: Understand the basic concept of Aurora I/O-Optimized.
* Objective 2: Learn the benefits of using Aurora I/O-Optimized.
* Objective 3: See how to get started with a demo of Aurora I/O-Optimized in the AWS console.

***To learn more about the services featured in this talk, please visit: https://aws.amazon.com/rds/aurora/pricing/

caption: True

title: Getting Started With pgvector and Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL
description:
🌟 Get started with pgvector and Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL: https://aws.amazon.com/rds/aurora/faqs/#Generative_AI

Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL-Compatible Edition supports the pgvector extension to store embeddings from machine learning (ML) models in your database and to perform efficient similarity searches. Embeddings are numerical representations (vectors) created from generative AI that capture the semantic meaning of text or images input into a large language model (LLM). With pgvector, you can query embeddings in your Aurora PostgreSQL database to perform efficient semantic similarity searches of these data types, represented as vectors, combined with other tabular data in Aurora. This enables the use of generative AI and other AI/ML systems to build new content, enable hyper-personalization, create interactive experiences, and more. In this video, you will learn how you can start using the pgvector extension with your Aurora PostgreSQL database.

📥💼 Download the slides: https://pages.awscloud.com/rs/112-TZM-766/images/2023_SN-0910-DAT_Slide-Deck.pdf

🔔 Subscribe to AWS Developers on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@awsdevelopers?sub_confirmation=1

Discover how to wield the power of Python and leverage Amazon SageMaker Studio Lab alongside experts Jessy and Ben. Through a hands-on, immersive experience, attendees will learn essential data analytics techniques. By the end of this workshop, participants will have gained invaluable skills in utilizing data for impactful insights within the criminal justice domain. This dynamic learning opportunity promises to equip justice advocates with the tools needed to drive meaningful change in our society.

title: Deep Dive into the Matrix Data Structure
description:
This video will provide you with a deep dive into the matrix data structure. It will explain the fundamentals of its usage, how data is organized in-memory, and provide visual representations of the elements. During the hands-on part, it will show how to create matrixes and fill with data, as well as how to transverse the matrix to perform operations on its elements. It will also share common problems found in coding interviews, such as how to print the matrix values in spiral order, column sorting, and checking if the matrix is a square one.

title: What's next in pgvector: Building AI-enabled apps with PostgreSQL - AWS Databases in 15
description:
Generative AI and Large Language Models (LLMs) are powerful technologies for building applications with richer and more personalized user experiences. This year, Amazon Aurora and Amazon RDS announced support for pgvector, an extension that allows you to store embeddings from machine learning (ML) models in your database and to perform efficient similarity searches. In this session, we’ll briefly introduce you to pgvector, how it works, and why it’s important. AWS has had the opportunity to collaborate with the PostgreSQL community on this extension, we want to dive into some upcoming enhancements to pgvector. We will close by talking about how you can get started contributing and/or using this extension in your own workloads.

***To learn more about the services featured in this talk, please visit: https://aws.amazon.com/rds/features/#Integrate_with_AI_and_ML
To download the slides visit: https://pages.awscloud.com/rs/112-TZM-766/images/2023_SN-1005-DAT_Slide-Deck.pdf

title: Getting started with Amazon Aurora zero-ETL integration with Amazon Redshift - AWS Databases in 15
description:
Amazon Aurora zero-ETL integration with Amazon Redshift enables near real-time analytics and machine learning (ML) on petabytes of transactional data stored in Amazon Aurora databases. Data written into Aurora is available in Amazon Redshift within seconds, so you can quickly act on it without having to build and maintain data pipelines to perform extract, transform, and load (ETL) operations. With Aurora zero-ETL integration with Amazon Redshift, you can bring together the transactional data of Aurora with the analytics capabilities of Amazon Redshift. In this session, you will learn how a zero-ETL integration can help you more easily run analytics in Amazon Redshift on operational data in an Aurora MySQL database.

🌟 Learn more: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/big-data/getting-started-guide-for-near-real-time-operational-analytics-using-amazon-aurora-zero-etl-integration-with-amazon-redshift

In this discussion, they explore the capabilities of Generative AI in risk assessment, vulnerability analysis, and code writing. Discover the nuances of large language models, the power of tools like Code Whisperer, and the future prospects of integrating AI into cybersecurity. title: Building a resilient client app with .NET and AWS IOT
description:
In this video, Derek Bingham, Developer Advocate at AWS, shows how create a client application that communicates with AWS IOT Core using MQTT and .NET.

Why MQTT ? Well often we need to build application clients that need to communicate  over congested or unreliable networks.  If this same application has a requirement that all data MUST be persisted, then using traditional REST or GraphQL style API's can get complicated

However there is another way and you can harness the power of the MQTT message protocol along with AWS IOT Core to build your next client application to be have a more resilient message delivery mechanism AND you can do this in .NET.

This video will show you exactly how!

To learn more about the services featured in this talk, please visit: 
https://github.com/aws-samples/iot-dotnet-publisher-consumer
https://github.com/dotnet/MQTTnet/wiki/ManagedClient - open source .NET managed client

00:00 Intro
02:00 Setting up AWS IOT Core
05:30 Building the Client
09:52 Certificates
14:35 Summary

title: Build high performance & cost-effective ML apps using Amazon SageMaker- AWS Virtual Workshop
description:
Managing the underlying infrastructure while building, training, and deploying machine learning (ML) models at scale can be technically intensive without the right tools and expertise. Amazon SageMaker is a fully managed ML service to build, train, and deploy ML models so you can focus on ML innovation instead of tedious infrastructure management. SageMaker offers you a choice of high-performance ML accelerators such as AWS Trainium and AWS Inferentia which are purpose-built for large-scale models such as LLMs and deliver 50% lower cost-to-train and 70% lower cost per inference. In this session, learn how you can build your own generative AI applications using Amazon SageMaker, AWS Trainium, and AWS Inferentia. In addition, we will also share how you can get started by using self-managed services such as AWS Deep Learning Container, AWS Deep learning AMIs, and ML frameworks and model libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch and Hugging Face.

***To learn more about the services featured in this talk, please visit: https://aws.amazon.com/machine-learning/infrastructure-innovation/
To download the slides visit:  https://pages.awscloud.com/rs/112-TZM-766/images/2023_VW-1012-MCL_Slide-Deck.pdf

title: Building a Leaderboard with Amazon Managed Service for Apache Flink | 1/5
description:
Looking to level up your analytics? In this video, we’re diving into the fundamentals of streaming architecture, and how you can use Amazon Kinesis Data Streams for data ingestion. We’ll also cover gaming leaderboards as a use case, before walking you through how to set up the architecture and complete the data ingestion challenge in your own AWS account.

Please note deploying the infrastructure shown in this series will incur costs in your AWS account, so remember to stop all resources like Managed Flink Studio Notebooks when you’re not using them.

In this series, Anand Shah (Data Analytics and Streaming Specialist at AWS) will help you build a modern data streaming architecture for a real-time gaming leaderboard. This architecture includes data ingestion, real-time enrichment with database change data capture (CDC), data processing, as well as computing, storing and visualizing the results. You will also learn advanced streaming analytics techniques, such as the control channel
method for A/B testing, updating features and parameters with zero downtime, and how to handle late arrival of data. Anand will also talk you through the process of data de-duplication, as well as how you can store historical data for replay on-demand. 🎉

🌟 Get started with Amazon Managed Service for Apache Flink: https://aws.amazon.com/managed-service-apache-flink/ today to build and run your fully managed Apache Flink applications on AWS!

🔗 Github repository: https://github.com/build-on-aws/real-time-gaming-leaderboard-apache-flink

title: Solving LLM Amnesia: Cross Session Memory
description:

This video explores the challenge of maintaining memory across multiple conversations with AI chatbots and demonstrates how to implement long-term memory using Agents for Amazon Bedrock. Key points covered:

💡 Explanation of why traditional large language models lack persistent memory
💡 Introduction to Amazon Bedrock's agent feature with long-term memory capabilities
💡 Step-by-step guide on creating an agent with memory in the Amazon Bedrock console
💡 Detailed walkthrough of implementing long-term memory programmatically using Python and boto3
💡 Demonstration of how the agent retains information across separate chat sessions
💡 Discussion of memory storage, retrieval, and integration into the AI's decision-making process

The video provides both conceptual understanding and practical implementation details, making it valuable for developers looking to enhance AI applications with persistent memory features.

title: AI Running Its Own Code: Agentic Code Interpreter
description:
(Amazon Bedrock Code Interpreter is available now in Public Preview.)

This video demonstrates how to use Amazon Bedrock's agentic code interpreter to enable AI models to perform complex mathematical and data analysis tasks. Mike shows how to create an agent using Claude 3 Sonnet that can write and execute Python code in a secure sandbox environment. Key points covered:

* Setting up an agent with code interpreter capabilities in Amazon Bedrock
* Writing Python code to programmatically create and configure the agent
* Using the agent to perform tasks like calculating Fibonacci sequences and plotting graphs
* Analyzing and visualizing sample billing data
* Exporting processed data as JSON for further use

title: Enhanced Data Flow in AWS Step Functions
description:
Developers have to take extra steps and transitions to identify state data and pass data from state to state. Extra transitions and complicated JSON Path queries are often required. AWS Step Functions is reducing this friction by introducing two new features. Variables for maintaining data across multiple states, and JSONata support for powerful json querying. In this video I cover how to use these features together to build more efficient state machines while reducing complexity and cost.

📚 Learn more: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/compute/simplifying-developer-experience-with-variables-and-jsonata-in-aws-step-functions/

title: Using Workflow Variables in AWS Step Function

title: How to Use Multimodal RAG to Extract Text, Images, & Tables (with Demos)
description:
In this video, you'll learn how to use Multimodal RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) to extract information from documents containing text, images, and tables. 

First, we'll extract these different data modalities using Python libraries like PyMuPDF. Then, we'll create embeddings for the extracted data using the Titan model from Amazon Bedrock. After storing the embeddings in a vector database, we can use a language model to retrieve relevant information and generate responses to queries. 

You'll see examples of asking questions related to text, images, and table data, showcasing Multimodal RAG's capability to handle multimodal inputs intelligently. Whether your data contains just text or a mix of modalities, this technique enables effective information retrieval and question answering.

🛠️ GitHub: https://github.com/debnsuma/fcc-ai-engineering-aws/tree/main/03-multimodal-rag

title: Building Multimodal Search with Milvus: Combining Images and Text for Better Search Results
description:
Learn how to build a powerful multimodal search application using open-source tools and models. This tutorial demonstrates how to combine image and text search capabilities using Milvus, an open-source vector database. Follow along as we create a three-step system that includes indexing, retrieval, and reranking using Hugging Face models, PyTorch, and Large Language Vision Models. We'll show you how to:

- Set up multimodal search using only open source tools
- Implement image and text embedding with Visualized BGE
- Create and query a vector database using Milvus
- Improve search results with LLVM-based reranking
- Build a practical example searching Amazon product images
Perfect for developers interested in implementing advanced search capabilities that understand both visual and textual content. 

Complete code and instructions available on the Zilliz site.

📚 Learn more: https://milvus.io/blog/multimodal-semantic-search-with-images-and-text.md

title: Building Agents with AWS: Complete Tutorial (Java, Spring AI, Amazon Bedrock & MCP)
description:
Get started with Amazon Bedrock 👉 https://a.co/gxM1DUy

Discover how Java developers can leverage the power of Spring AI, Amazon Bedrock, and the Model Context Protocol (MCP) to build an AI-powered dog adoption service. This step-by-step tutorial covers everything from using AI models to integrating with external data & services.

In this hands-on tutorial, Josh and James demonstrate how Java developers can create an AI-powered dog adoption application using Spring AI, Amazon Bedrock, and Model Context Protocol (MCP). They walk through the entire process, starting with setting up the development environment and configuring the necessary dependencies.

The video covers integrating large language models (LLMs) like Amazon’s Nova Pro model for natural language processing and the Cohere model for text embeddings. You’ll learn how to use system prompts, user prompts, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) to provide contextual responses.

Josh and James also dive into vector stores, showcasing how to store and retrieve relevant data using semantic similarity searches. They demonstrate the integration of tools and remote services using the Model Context Protocol (MCP), enabling seamless communication between the AI assistant and external systems.

Throughout the tutorial, you’ll gain insights into advanced AI engineering techniques, such as agentic systems and iterative model interactions. By the end, you’ll have a solid understanding of how to build AI-powered applications using Java and Spring AI, opening up new possibilities for enhancing user experiences and streamlining business processes.

title: What is MCP? No, Really!
description:
In this video, Mike Chambers, Sr. Developer Advocate at AWS, explains the ins and outs of MCP (Model Context Protocol), an open source protocol from Anthropic that enables the creation of agentic systems with LLMs (large language models). Explore how MCP decouples agents from servers, allowing for seamless integration with cloud-based resources and remote functionality.

He’ll walk you through a demo of MCP in action with Amazon Q CLI, showcasing its ability to retrieve and process the latest information from AWS documentation.

You’ll gain insights into the key components of MCP, including agents, servers, tools, resources, and prompts. Learn how this decoupled architecture changes the way we build agentic systems, paving the way for more flexibility and innovation in the AI landscape.

Getting Started with MCP in Amazon Bedrock 👉 https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/harness-the-power-of-mcp-servers-with-amazon-bedrock-agents/?trk=b3b9d316-6b02-496c-a7c6-100dbb9e16e0&sc_channel=sm

title: Integrating Model Context Protocol (MCP) Tools with Strands Agents (How-to)
description:
Learn more about Strands Agents: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/opensource/introducing-strands-agents-an-open-source-ai-agents-sdk/?trk=4db675d3-97dd-4003-b0c1-b8d65e02b1c3&sc_channel=sm

In this video, we dive deep into the Model Context Protocol (MCP) and explore how to integrate MCP tools with Strands Agents. We start by demonstrating a locally hosted MCP server that provides a simple dice rolling tool. You'll learn how to import the MCPClient, configure the server parameters, and pass the available tools to your Strands Agent.

We then take it a step further by showcasing a cloud-hosted MCP server running on AWS Lambda. You'll see how to connect your Strands Agent to this remote server using a streamable HTTP endpoint. Throughout the video, we engage in an interactive dice rolling session, illustrating the agentic flow and showcasing the seamless integration of MCP tools.

Additionally, we discuss best practices for securing your MCP servers, including using a custom authorizer and session store with DynamoDB. Instructions and code for deploying your own MCP servers on AWS Lambda are provided in the description.

title: Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Hebrew)
description:
Amazon MSK is a fully managed service that makes it easy for you to build and run applications that use Apache Kafka to process streaming data. With a few clicks in the AWS console you can create highly available Apache Kafka clusters with settings and configuration based on Kafka’s deployment best practices. Amazon MSK allows you to build and run production applications on Apache Kafka without needing Kafka infrastructure management expertise or having to deal with the complex overheads associated with running Apache Kafka on your own.  

During the webinar, we will cover:  
1. Learn about the features and benefits of Amazon MSK

title: Data Labelings using Amazon SageMaker GroundTruth (Hebrew)
description:
Successful machine learning models are built on the shoulders of large volumes of high-quality training data. But, the process to create the training data necessary to build these models is often expensive, complicated, and time-consuming. 
The majority of models created today require a human to manually label data in a way that allows the model to learn how to make correct decisions.
SageMaker Ground Truth uses a machine learning model to automatically label raw data to produce high-quality training datasets quickly at a fraction of the cost of manual labeling.

caption: False

title: AutoML with Amazon Autopilot (Hebrew)
description:
Building machine learning (ML) models has traditionally required a binary choice. On one hand, you could manually prepare the features, select the algorithm, and optimize the model parameters in order to have full control over the model design and understand all the thought that went into creating it. However, this approach requires deep ML expertise. On the other hand, if you don’t have that expertise, you could use an automated approach (AutoML) to model generation that takes care of all of the heavy lifting, but provides very little visibility into how the model was created. While a model created with AutoML can work well, you may have less trust in it because you can’t understand what went into it, you can’t recreate it, and you can’t learn best practices which may help you in the future.


Amazon SageMaker Autopilot eliminates this choice, allowing you to automatically build machine learning models without compromises. With SageMaker Autopilot, you provide a tabular dataset and select the target column to predict, which can be a number (such as a house price, called regression), or a category (such as spam/not spam, called classification). SageMaker Autopilot will automatically explore different solutions to find the best model. You then can directly deploy the model to production with just one click, or iterate on the recommended solutions with Amazon SageMaker Studio to further improve the model quality.


Level: 200-300 Subscribe to AWS Online Tech Talks On AWS:

#AWS
caption: False

title: Model debugging time from days to minutes (Hebrew)
description:
Interested in learning how to debug model characteristics during training?

Training ML models is a multi-step, complex task that is iterative and time-consuming. During training, ML models learn patterns in the training data to make accurate predictions. This learning occurs through multiple iterations of the data and adjusting the parameter values for each iteration. It is challenging to ensure that a model is progressively learning the correct values of the different parameters. Additionally, it is not easy to analyze and debug model characteristics without building additional tools, making the entire process cumbersome.


Amazon SageMaker Debugger makes it much easier to easily analyze and debug model characteristics during training, using the Amazon SageMaker Studio visual interface. When anomalies are detected, SageMaker Debugger sends alerts for developers’ to take remedial actions, reducing the time it takes to debug models from days to minutes. The debug data remains in the customer’s AWS account, allowing SageMaker Debugger to be used for most privacy-sensitive applications.

description:
This is the forth session on the CFM enablement program. In this session we will focus on EC2 Spot Instances, which are spare EC2 compute capacity that you can use for up to 90% off the On-Demand price, and can be interrupted by EC2 when it needs the capacity back. We’ll show you how to design your workloads to be Spot compatible, so Spot interruptions won’t impact your application’s performance and availability. Spot Instances are a great fit for containerized workloads, stateless EC2 applications, Big-Data processing, dev/test and CI/CD, High Performance Computing, and more. #AWS
caption: False

title: Build Data Engineering Platforms with Amazon EMR (hebrew)
description:
Amazon EMR is one of the largest Spark and Hadoop service providers in the world, enabling customers to run ETL, machine learning, real-time processing, data science, and low-latency SQL at petabyte scale. In this session, we introduce design patterns such as using Amazon S3 instead of HDFS, taking advantage of both long- and short-lived clusters, using notebooks, and other architectural best practices. We discuss lowering cost with Auto Scaling and Spot Instances, and security best practices for encryption and fine-grained access control. We showcase key improvements made to the service in 2020. We cover improvements in using the Amazon EMR API, best practices utilizing Spot instances and Spot Instances with Auto Scaling, improvements toward Amazon S3 performance on Amazon EMR, and security/authorization and authentication. We couple each of these with a demo or customer use case to illustrate the benefits. If you are an existing Amazon EMR user, you walk away with a thorough understanding of improvements made in 2020, and how they benefit you. If you are a new Amazon EMR user, get an understanding of common use cases and how other customers are using Amazon EMR.

Join us to a one hour Webinar on how to reduce the development and running cost of your machine learning projects:Reducing TCO by utilizing the cloud to build on top of fully managed servicesAchieving project MVP faster and cheaper.Reducing cost of creating an annotated dataset: outsourcing workers, active learning and high quality annotations.Reducing time and cost for training and tuning models: experiment faster, achieving scale-efficiency by choosing the right hardware and framework, utilizing Spot instance.Reducing cost for hosting and monitoring models: multi-model endpoints and autoscaling, model monitoring and cost-efficient hardware accelerators (GPUs and ASIC chips).Target audience: ML engineers, devops, data scientists, R&D managers. Very basic familiarity with cloud services is assumed. Subscribe to AWS Online Tech Talks On AWS:

title: AWS Cloud Development Kit CDK (Hebrew)
description:
The AWS CDK is a new software development framework from AWS with the sole purpose of making it fun and easy to define cloud infrastructure in your favorite programming language and deploy it using AWS CloudFormation.So what are we going to build? Nothing too fancy…Then, you’ll write a little “Hello, world” Lambda function and front it with an API Gateway endpoint so users can call it via an HTTP request.By the end of this workshop, you’ll be able to:- Create new CDK applications.- Define your app’s infrastructure using the AWS Construct Library- Deploy your CDK apps to your AWS account- Define your own reusable constructs- Consume constructs published by other people. title: Migrate to AWS Databases: The Freedom to Save, Grow, and Innovate - AWS Online Tech Talks
description:
Frustrated with high cost, poor scalability, and other performance issues, customers are looking to move to fully managed cloud databases, or to break free from the restrictive nature of legacy databases, to save, grow and innovate. AWS offers fully managed services at 1/10th of the cost of commercial databases, and 3x5 the performance of popular alternatives.  In this tech talk, you will learn the modernization challenges organizations face, how to overcome them, the success customers like Samsung experienced, and our commitment to your migration success with tools, experts, incentives, and programs like Database Freedom and Database Migration Accelerator.

Learning Objectives: 
*Learn the reasons why organizations are moving away from self-managed databases 
*Explore the best migration path forward, and top migration considerations 
*Learn how AWS can help you migrate your mission-critical workloads through tools, experts, and programs

caption: True

title: Why Contact Center Customers Choose Amazon WorkSpaces and Amazon AppStream 2.0
description:
Contact center agents are the front-line to customer experience and customer satisfaction. Today, organizations around the world are looking to empower their contact center agents with the data, applications, and other resources they need to successfully serve the evolving needs of their customers. In this tech talk, we will cover key business challenges that organizations face as they attempt to modernize and scale their contact centers and how Amazon WorkSpaces and Amazon AppStream 2.0 can address these challenges in a scalable, secure, reliable, compliant and cost-effective manner. We will also provide real-world examples from current customers who have successfully enabled their contact center agents to get their job done securely, productively, and reliably with our services and as a result accelerated their digital transformation.

Learning Objectives: 
*Learn what AWS End-user Compute (EUC) Services, Amazon WorkSpaces, & Amazon AppStream 2.0, are 
*Understand contact center business challenges, and how AWS EUC Services address those challenges 
*Learn how our customers such as Maximus, Enova, and others utilize these services to allow their contact center agents to securely and reliably access the business applications they need to get their job done

***To learn more about the services featured in this talk, please visit: https://aws.amazon.com/products/end-user-computing/ Subscribe to AWS Online Tech Talks On AWS:

title: Get up to 40% Better Price Performance in EC2 with AWS Graviton2 - AWS Online Tech Talks
description:
AWS Graviton2 processors power Amazon EC2 T4g, M6g, C6g, and R6g instances, and their variants with local NVMe-based SSD storage, that provide up to 40% better price performance over comparable current generation x86-based instances1 for a wide variety of workloads, including application servers, micro-services, high-performance computing, electronic design automation, gaming, open-source databases, and in-memory caches. In this tech talk, we will present instance types, demoes, and adoption stories.

Learning Objectives: 
*Learn how AWS Graviton2 enables the best price performance in Amazon EC2 
*Understand how AWS Graviton2 supports a wide variety of workloads 
*Learn about how customers using AWS Graviton2 based instances get up to 40% better price performance

caption: True

title: Industrial IoT: Proving Value Fast - AWS Virtual Workshop
description:
Many customers fear high upfront investments and an uncertain RoI for Industrial IoT. This webinar is about how to prove value fast with real world IIoT applications based on a minimal investment. You will learn how the CloudRail solution enables extremely fast IIoT pilots, while ensuring the necessary flexibility for large scale roll-outs at the same time. By combining CloudRail with AWS IoT, customers can start their IIoT journey based on a scalable and enterprise grade platform right from the first pilot project. Moreover, hear about Bechtle’s IIoT starter bundles which leverage the CloudRail solution to offer a complete IIoT pilot project at a fixed price of 4500€ including hardware, AWS subscription, installation, and several workshops. Instead of endless PowerPoint slides, we’ll do many live demos and talk about real world scenarios.

Learning Objectives:
 - Learn about AWS qualified partner hardware and AWS IoT edge software offerings that provide a streamlined industrial data collection process.
 - Discover AWS Partner Solutions for a wide range of use cases to optimize factory output, improve product quality, maximize asset utilization, and identify equipment maintenance issues.
 - Learn how solutions can be deployed quickly to rapidly realize business value for your Industrial IoT projects.

caption: True

title: Now is the Time: Reduce Cost and Gain Business Value by Moving to AWS Storage - AWS Online Tech Talk
description:
Enterprises expect an average of 30–40% data growth annually, pressuring the limits of on-premises infrastructure. They want to increase their agility to take advantage of this data and deliver new capabilities to their businesses, while reducing the escalating costs they’re incurring on-premises. As cloud adoption matures, organizations are rapidly expanding their use in terms of the diversity of applications and use cases, increasingly deploying their existing enterprise workloads on cloud. In this tech talk, you’ll learn what trends are being seen across organizations like yours as they move to cloud, factors that drive choices of what services to adopt, and cost reduction and agility benefits they realize over time after their adoption of AWS Storage services.

Learning Objectives: 
*Learn why organizations are accelerating their move to the cloud 
*Learn about the business value organizations have realized over time as a result of moving workloads to AWS Storage, based on independent research 
*Learn about the cost benefits of moving to cloud storage, and how to optimize costs with AWS

#AWS
caption: True

title: AWS Dev Day Security: Effective Security for Modern Applications (Hebrew)
description:
This session shows you how to identify and mitigate risks of modern application architectures. By example, we show you how to shift left with security in your development pipeline using CodeGuru and static source code scanning while deploying a single page web applications that integrates with Lambda functions. Next, we shift right by showing you how to use OpenTelemetry, CloudWatch and Prometheus server to instrument and monitor your workload. We move on to demonstrate using PaloAlto Prisma for run time protection of the Serverless backend. Finally, we review how to document your architecture for security review by a security audience using AWS Perspective and Well Architected frameworks.

Speaker: Maish Saidel-Keesing, Solutions Architect, AWS

caption: True

title: Disrupting the Economics of File Storage with Amazon EFS One Zone Storage Classes
description:
Join us and learn about two new Amazon EFS One Zone storage classes that are disrupting the economics of cloud file storage, and paving the way for workloads previously thought to be better served as self-managed file systems. Applications running in self-managed, single-site environments on-premises, or on self-managed single zone file systems in the cloud, that don’t require highest availability and durability of Amazon EFS Standard storage classes, could be costing you too much. Learn how Amazon EFS One Zone storage classes can reduce your file storage costs by 47%, when compared to Amazon EFS Standard storage classes. Workloads like development build and staging, simulations, content management, and secondary data that can be easily recreated are ideal for Amazon EFS One Zone storage classes.

Learning Objectives: 
*Learn about the Amazon EFS four storage classes, 2 new EFS One Zone storage classes, and two existing Standard storage classes 
*Understanding how to reduce Amazon EFS costs by 47%, when compared to Amazon EFS Standard storage classes 
*Gain an understanding for which use cases are aligned to Amazon EFS One Zone storage classes, and how to get started using Amazon EFS One Zone storage classes

***To learn more about the services featured in this talk, please visit: http://aws.amazon.com/blogs/aws/new-lower-cost-one-zone-storage-classes-for-amazon-elastic-file-system Subscribe to AWS Online Tech Talks On AWS:

title: Train Machine Learning Models Better, Cheaper, and Faster Using Amazon SagMaker Debugger
description:
It's time to stop manually tracking training metrics and switch to automatic alerts when model or system inefficiencies are detected. Amazon SageMaker Debugger makes it easy to optimize machine learning (ML) models by capturing training metrics in real-time such as loss, accuracy, and gradients and sending alerts when anomalies are detected. In this tech talk, we will show you how this works through an end-to-end example. We'll collect tensor data, utilize built-in rules to detect problems within a model and within system resources, and then automate remediation of issues. We will explore visualizations so you can see how easy it is to track metrics compared to manual techniques.

Learning Objectives: 
*Learn how to use Amazon SageMaker Debugger to easily collect training data 
*Learn how to use Amazon SageMaker Debugger’s automated actioning feature to terminate poorly performing training jobs and configure automated alerts 
*Learn how to use the automated visualizations provided by Amazon SageMaker Debugger to identify resource bottlenecks and evaluate model performance

title: Forrester Explains the Total Economic Impact™ of Working with AWS Customer Enablement Services
description:
Migrating to the cloud can help you meet rapidly changing customer demands, create new and compelling customer experiences, and drive down infrastructure costs. However, most companies lack the resources and skills required for migration, ongoing cloud management, transforming existing apps, and building new cloud apps quickly and securely. AWS Customer Enablement services augment your teams’ cloud skills with deep AWS expertise, dedicated resources, modern technology, and hands-on guidance through AWS Professional Services, AWS Managed Services, AWS Enterprise Support, and AWS Training and Certification. AWS recently commissioned Forrester Consulting to conduct a Total Economic Impact™ (TEI) study for AWS Customer Enablement services. Join us to learn about the Forrester framework to evaluate the financial impact of working with AWS Customer Enablement Services covering benefits, costs, risk, and flexibility. We will guide you through the methodology used to derive the study results which uncovered a benefits of $28.2M (present value) and a ROI of 136% for AWS Customer Enablement services, experienced in addition of benefits of moving to the cloud in general.

Learning Objectives: 
*Learn about the state of enterprise cloud adoption, including the gaps in skills required to build new apps, transform existing apps, and migrate infrastructure and data from on-premises to the cloud 
*Learn how AWS Customer Enablement services augment your team’s cloud skills and supports your cloud transformation journey 
*Understand the business benefits and cost savings your organization could expect from an investment in AWS Customer Enablement services

title: Introduction and Building a Foundation for Enterprise Cloud Operations - AWS Virtual Workshop
description:

title: Building Next-Gen Consumer Products with AWS IoT Edge Services - AWS Online Tech Talks
description:
As the use of consumer IoT devices in the home and on-the-go, such as wearables like connected headphones or fitness devices, continue to grow, more and more data is being pushed to the cloud, where the latest IoT and machine learning (ML) technologies are enabling new innovations in connected home applications. Many consumer devices must act on data generated locally in order to respond quickly to events, while still using the cloud for management, analytics, and storage. High-performance edge applications rely on the cloud for processing, analytics, storage, and machine learning, but also need to do some processing, like ML inference, close to where data is generated to deliver intelligent real-time responsiveness, and reduce the amount of data transferred. This tech talk provides an overview of AWS IoT edge services, FreeRTOS and AWS IoT Greengrass, that consumer device manufacturers can use to build, deploy, and manage devices that they can control and operate at the edge.

Learning Objectives: 
-Learn about key consumer IoT at the edge use cases, and which use cases are best for respective AWS IoT edge services 
-Learn how AWS customer, Edn, built and manages a connected indoor smart garden with FreeRTOS and AWS IoT services

#AWS
caption: True

title: Deploy Globally Available MongoDB-Compatible Clusters with Amazon DocumentDB - AWS Online Tech Talk
description:
Critical workloads with a global footprint have strict availability requirements and may need to tolerate a region-wide outage. In this webinar, we will show how to run critical, global workloads in Amazon DocumentDB (with MongoDB compatibility) by automatically replicating data across multiple AWS regions, with sub-second latencies, using Amazon DocumentDB Global Clusters. Amazon DocumentDB is a highly scalable and fully managed document database service. Amazon DocumentDB now offers Global Clusters to provide disaster recovery from region-wide outages and enable low-latency global reads. Global Clusters replicates your data to clusters in up to 5 AWS regions with little to no impact on performance, with a typical lag less than one second. In this webinar, you will learn about key use cases for Amazon DocumentDB Global Clusters, how it enables you to support low latency and DR for globally distributed applications, and see a demonstration of the new feature.

Learning Objectives: 
-Learn how Amazon DocumentDB Global Clusters enables you to deploy a cluster that spans up to 5 AWS regions with little to no impact on performance
-Learn how Amazon DocumentDB Global Clusters enables low-latency global reads and provides disaster recovery for region-wide outages with a very low Recovery Time Objective (RTO)
-Learn how to get started with Amazon DocumentDB Global Clusters today

**To learn more about the services featured in this talk, please visit: https://aws.amazon.com/documentdb/ Subscribe to AWS Online Tech Talks On AWS:

title: Get Ahead in the Cloud: Accelerate Cloud Transformation with Partner Software and Services
description:
As organizations face rapidly changing customer demands and increasing competition, the pace of technological innovation continues to accelerate. Organizations are looking for new ways to stay ahead of the curve and streamline the software supply chain, optimize productivity, and become more operationally efficient. Legacy software licensing processes are time-consuming with lengthy procurement cycles that inhibit innovation and lack visibility into software usage across the organization. In order to meet the growing demands and streamline these transitions, many organizations are shifting software procurement processes to cloud marketplaces. The percentage of code that developers leverage from external sources, such as cloud marketplaces, will rise to 80% by 2025 from 30% in 2019 (source: IDC FutureScape, Worldwide IT Industry 2020 Predictions, October 2019). Join this tech talk to learn how to modernize your organization’s software supply chain through AWS Marketplace and its catalog of independent software vendors and services. AWS Marketplace helps streamline procurement processes with enterprise-wide visibility and transparency, simplified subscription and billing, enhanced governance, and optimized IT spend.

Learning Objectives:

*Learn how to streamline software procurement while reducing costs

#AWS

title: Broadband Freedom: Unlocking Insights & Improving CPE Device Management with AWS
description:
More than ever before, consumers rely on their home networks for work, entertainment, and day-to-day life. Consumers are connecting more and more smart devices to the network, rely on high-speed connections to work from home, and stream rich content such as HD movies and video games. To power these experiences, telcos and communication service providers (CSPs) use a range of Customer Premises Equipment (CPE) (i.e. Set Top Boxes (STB), Broadband Routers, Wi-Fi Extenders, and Home Gateways) to deliver service offerings to customers. In this tech talk, we will discuss how Service Providers are using the cloud to develop innovative strategies that help them gather new data insights from their CPE device fleets and improve the way CPE devices are managed. With CPE data available for analysis in the cloud, service providers can use analytics and AI/ML tools to solve business problems (customer churn and retention analytics, predictive hardware diagnostics) and to improve their customer’s quality of experience (self-healing intelligent CPE devices, as an example). This session demonstrates how Service Providers can use AWS and AWS IoT services to enhance their current CPE management platforms, connect CPE devices securely to the cloud at scale, and to make use of the CPE data to improve their products and enhance consumer experiences.

Learning Objectives: 
*Learn use cases for the next generation of CPE devices powered by IoT, AI/ML and application management at the edge 
*Learn how Service Providers can securely and easily enhance their CPE data analytics and device management systems with AWS and AWS IoT 
*Understand how AWS and AWS IoT services can help Service Providers transform their broadband service and related offerings to deliver differentiated consumer experiences

***To learn more about the services featured in this talk, please visit: https://aws.amazon.com/iot/solutions/connected-home/ Subscribe to AWS Online Tech Talks On AWS:

title: Process Documents Faster Using AWS Machine Learning - AWS Online Tech Talks
description:
Not all documents are the same, for example, insurance claims can have tables, forms, dense text, or free form text. Extracting the data on these documents can take many people hours, multiple workflows, and often times doesn’t sync with downstream systems. How do you pull all the data points off the page using Machine Learning (ML)? Learn how Liberty Mutual processes insurance claims using AWS machine learning to overcome manual processes, reduce cost per claim, and speed up response times for their customers. 

Learning Objectives:

#AWS
caption: False

title: Detect potential bias in your datasets and explain how your models predict (Hebrew)
description:
As ML models are built by training algorithms that learn statistical patterns present in datasets, several questions immediately come to mind. First, can we ever hope to explain why our ML model comes up with a particular prediction? Second, what if our dataset doesn’t faithfully describe the real-life problem we were trying to model? Could we even detect such issues? Would they introduce some sort of bias in imperceptible ways? These are not speculative questions at all, and their implications can be far-reaching. Unfortunately, even with the best of intentions, bias issues may exist in datasets and be introduced into models with business, ethical, and legal consequences.

It is thus important for model builders and administrators to be aware of potential sources of bias in production systems. In addition, many companies and organizations need ML models to be explainable before they can be used in production. In fact, some regulations explicitly require model explainability for consequential decision making. In this hands-on session, you’ll learn how Amazon SageMaker Clarify can help you tackle bias and explainability issues, and how to use it with both the SageMaker Studio user interface and the SageMaker SDK. You’ll also see how it works together with SageMaker Model Monitor to track bias metrics over time on your prediction endpoints.


Resources:
https://aws.amazon.com/sagemaker/clarify/
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sagemaker/latest/dg/clarify-detect-post-training-bias.html
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sagemaker/latest/dg/clarify-model-explainability.html
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sagemaker/latest/dg/clarify-model-monitor-bias-drift.html
https://sagemaker.readthedocs.io/en/stable/api/training/processing.html
https://pages.awscloud.com/rs/112-TZM-766/images/Fairness.Measures.for.Machine.Learning.in.Finance.pdf
https://pages.awscloud.com/rs/112-TZM-766/images/Amazon.AI.Fairness.and.Explainability.Whitepaper.pdf
https://github.com/aws/amazon-sagemaker-clarify
https://github.com/slundberg/shap
https://github.com/aws/amazon-sagemaker-examples/tree/master/sagemaker_processing/fairness_and_explainability Subscribe to AWS Online Tech Talks On AWS:

title: Transform Your Bug Bashes into an AWS BugBust - AWS Online Tech Talks
description:
Developers are constantly looking for ways to make applications more secure, reduce costs and spend less time on critical, cumbersome and arduous inspection processes. While some organizations hold bug bashes where teams collaborate to manually find bugs and fix problematic code, these events have time constraints that make it challenging for even the most skilled and motivated developers to work together, share best practices, and receive support. Introducing AWS BugBust, the world’s largest code challenge for Java and Python developers to fix 1 million bugs, improve application reliability and reduce technical debt by over $100M. In this session we will unveil, how you can transform traditional bug bashes and empower developers to get code quality right, in a uniform manner, and enable them to celebrate their bug bashing achievements. Join to learn how Nextroll Inc. enabled their Developers to go head-to-head with their teammates in their own private BugBust event and helped save their company money by cleaning up their code.

Learning Objectives:

title: Take the Graviton Challenge, Get up to 40% Better Price Performance in EC2 - AWS Online Tech Talks
description:
AWS Graviton2 processors are custom-designed by AWS to enable the best price performance for workloads in Amazon EC2. Thousands of customers are adopting Graviton2-based EC2 instances and realizing up to 40% better price performance over comparable fifth generation x86-based instances. Using the experience from working with these customers, AWS has created a step-by-step 4-day plan to make it easy for you to adopt Graviton2 based instances and realize the same price performance benefits. By taking the Graviton Challenge, you can follow this 4-day plan to move your first workload to Graviton2. After taking the challenge, you can also enter a contest to win prizes, including a trip and chance to present at re:Invent 2021. In this tech talk, we'll give you an overview of the Graviton Challenge and the 4-day plan, and a quick demo on migrating your workload to Graviton2 based instances.

Learning Objectives: 
*Learn how AWS Graviton2 enables the best price performance for workloads in Amazon EC2 for a wide variety of workloads 
*Understand how to take the Graviton Challenge to move your workloads to Graviton2 based instances in as little as 4 days 
*Get swag and enter the contest to win prizes, including a trip and chance to present at re:Invent 2021

title: Move to Managed Amazon RDS Open Source to Increase Efficiency and Innovation - AWS Online Tech Talks
description:
For customers self-managing relational database infrastructure, provisioning, operating, scaling, and managing databases is tedious, time-consuming, and expensive. Amazon Relational Database Service allows you to simply launch an optimally configured, secure, and highly available database using one of three popular and familiar engines: MySQL, MariaDB, or PostgreSQL. title: Optimize Numerical Weather Predictions on AWS Graviton2 - AWS Online Tech Talks
description:
The Weather Research and Forecasting (WRF) model is a numerical weather prediction (NWP) system designed to serve both atmospheric research and operational forecasting needs. With the release of Arm-based AWS Graviton2 Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) instances, a common question has been how these instances perform on large-scale NWP workloads. In this tech talk we will demo running NWP on AWS Graviton2 and share benchmarking results from running NWP across three different instance types. Learn how you can optimize price performance when running your WRF simulations on AWS with AWS Graviton2.

Learning Objectives: 
*Learn how to effectively use Graviton-based instances for your HPC applications, including Numerical Weather Prediction (NWP) applications 
*Understand how you can achieve higher performance in your NWP applications through the use of Elastic Fabric Adapter (EFA) 
*Learn how different instance types can allow you to scale your workloads efficiently

title: How operational excellence can make or break your migration - AWS Virtual Workshop
description:
One of the keys to a successful migration to the cloud is having a well-defined operating model before, during, and after migration. Defining how you will operate your workloads before you migrate them will speed migration and ensure a successful transition. The skills and tools that worked on-premises do not guarantee the right results for your workloads in the cloud. AWS has many services and capabilities that can be used to create a new cloud operating model that will meet your governance and control requirements and minimize risk. In this virtual workshop we will share how AWS Managed Services has approached this topic and some of the lessons learned as we provide operations for some of the world’s largest enterprises. Join this session to learn how you can apply some of these same principals to your migration and achieve ongoing success in the cloud.

Learning objectives:
- Learn why operations matters before, during, and after migrations.
- Discover native AWS tools that can help you effectively operate your AWS cloud infrastructure at scale.
- Learn about how AWS Managed Services can help you to operate your cloud infrastructure. Subscribe to AWS Online Tech Talks On AWS:

title: Move data archives to AWS to lower costs and gain new insights - AWS Online Tech Talks
description:
Enterprises today face significant challenges with exponential data growth. Regulatory compliance requires long retention periods for a lot of that data. As the volume of data grows, you need to store that data more cost effectively while unlocking the value of your data with analytics and machine learning from AWS. Everyone around the world has archival data—every company, every vertical, and every industry. Often petabytes of data need to be stored indefinitely, such as medical records, news media content, and manufacturing datasets. AWS data archiving solutions eliminate the infrastructure management headache for your team while creating value for your business. There is no better place for archive data to be than in AWS.

Learning Objectives:
        * Objective 1 - Learn about the benefits customers achieve when archiving data in AWS.
        * Objective 2 - Learn about the AWS archive storage solutions for long term retention, compliance, and digital preservation.
        * Objective 3 - Learn how to innovate faster by focusing your highly valuable IT resources on developing applications that differentiate your business instead of the undifferentiated heavy lifting of managing archival data on your data centers.

#AWS
caption: True

title: Modernize data protection with AWS - AWS Online Tech Talks
description:
A data protection strategy is essential to making sure your company can withstand, recover, and minimize the impact of a security breach, outage, or disaster. With cloud storage services, you automatically meet the storage industry’s “3-2-1” best practice guidelines for data backup protection against data loss and, in turn, lost revenue. The 3-2-1 rule is centered around maintaining at least three copies of your data, two of which may be on premises but on different devices, while you store at least one copy off-site (in the cloud).

Learning Objectives:
        * Objective 1 - Get the latest SMB data trends
        * Objective 2 - Review key data protection concepts and apply them in disaster and ransomware recovery solutions
        * Objective 3 - Learn about the benefits of using cloud storage services to protect your organization's application data and business continuity

***To learn more about the services featured in this talk, please visit: https://amer.resources.awscloud.com/storage-backup-restore?trk=9e4fbed1-a286-4fb3-a80b-2aaf9b623455&sc_channel=el

title: Smart Manufacturing Episode #1 - The road to digitalization: Nitrex success story
description:
"Nitrex is a global provider of fully integrated heat-treating solutions and technologies. The company sought to improve product and customer service to differentiate from competitors and gain market share. For that, Nitrex needed to optimize scrap rate to reduce associated costs, improve flow control and OEE. In addition, the project was complicated by the requirement to coordinate with a high number of brownfield installations and teams across multiple locations.

Nitrex worked with Syntax, an AWS Partner, to map their digital transformation journey and optimize business results. The recommended solution included process and machine data analytics using industrial IoT cloud solutions running on AWS services and integrated with SAP.

In this session, hear an overview of the full project’s cycle, from gathering requirements to the different stages, implementations, and management change adoptions that were needed to be successful. Attendees will gain an understanding of the Nitrex digital transformation journey, business outcomes, and next steps."

Learning Objectives:
        * Objective 1 - Hear how Nitrex improved their operational efficiency.
        * Objective 2 - Dive into the use case to understand Nitrex’s digital transformation journey.
        * Objective 3 - Identify how solutions can be deployed to realize business value for Industrial IoT projects.

***To learn more about the services featured in this talk, please visit: https://aws.amazon.com/iot-sitewise/

title: Smart Manufacturing Episode #2 - How IoT can increase manufacturing productivity
description:
Industrial companies from all around the world are embracing digital transformation to leverage productivity. However the complexity of industrial environments can be very challenging. Join this episode to understand how technology can leverage financial gains and how the right architecture can reduce the total cost of ownership of these projects, avoiding the traps of custom code, and integrating IT, OT and Cloud.

Learn about Pirelli’s implementation with Telit, an AWS Partner, to enable the high-volume collection of complex machine data, orchestrate time series data, and integrate data into the AWS Enterprise Data Platform. The solution enabled intra- and inter-factory services at Pirelli which improved their access to data, operational intelligence, and identify execution actions landscape.

Learning Objectives: 
* Objective 1: Hear how Pirelli improved their access to data to address OEE.
* Objective 2: Dive into the use case to understand Pirelli’s focus on improving industrial business processes with data.
* Objective 3: Identify how solutions can be deployed to realize business value for Industrial IoT projects.

title: Understanding the Total Economic Impact of a Fully Managed DaaS Service - AWS Online Tech Talks
description:
The surge towards remote working during the COVID-19 pandemic has driven organizations that historically invested in on-premises virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) to explore cloud-hosted desktops, desktop as a service (DaaS), and hybrid models to deliver virtual end-user computing. In this webinar AWS and guest Forrester explain the return-on-investment when adopting a fully managed DaaS service based on a commissioned research study of 4 current Amazon WorkSpaces customers conducted by Forrester Consulting on behalf of Amazon Web Services.

Learning Objectives: 
* Objective 1: Understanding the business value of migrating on-prem VDI solutions to the cloud.
* Objective 2: Understanding how AWS has helped existing customers adopt next generation cloud infrastructure.
* Objective 3: Understanding how AWS EUC solutions, including Amazon WorkSpaces is a great choice to support a VDI cloud migration strategy.

title: How Blueair (Unilever brand) went from idea to product on market within a year, using AWS IoT
description:
To achieve the global scalability necessary to support a growing number of connected devices around the world, Blueair rapidly developed and deployed its HealthProtect product line using an IoT system on Amazon Web Services (AWS). Building on AWS enables enhanced security and privacy for Blueair’s customers and supports releases of new and upgraded features so that every air purifier continues to deliver value throughout its life span. “Freedom to breathe clean, healthy air as nature intended is our promise to consumers,” says Johan Alvenberg, Head of IoT at Blueair. “By proactively monitoring the air quality and ensuring 24/7 protection against harmful pollutants, we are doing just that. For the tech savvy we have also added smart, premium usability and functions.”

Learning Objectives: 
* Objective 1: Hear how Blueair (Unilever brand) adapted and scaled globally their connected IoT devices and transformed their business within a year.
* Objective 2: Dive into the use case to understand Blueair (Unilever brand) focus on improving Connected devices and enriching customers life with smart features.
* Objective 3: Identify how solutions can be deployed to realize business value for Connected IoT devices.

title: Strengthening and Streamlining COVID Compliance Verification - AWS Online Tech Talk
description:
The COVID-19 pandemic has forced organizations to require proof of vaccination and negative test results based on regularly changing guidelines. In this Tech Talk we will share details of how CloudHSM can be used to deploy a digital solution for verifying proof of vaccination and negative test results.. This Tech Talk will cover how CloudHSM can be used to create a QR code with an embedded digital signature of proof of vaccination and negative test results. It will demonstrate how the QR code can be scanned with a mobile device and validate the digital signature with a form of identification (i.e. driver’s license or passport).

Learning Objectives: 
* Objective 1: Customers understand an applications for CloudHSM due to COVID-19 mandates.
* Objective 2: Customers understand a technical implementation of CloudHSM.
* Objective 3: Helping customers understand when to use CloudHSM vs alternative services such as KMS.

title: Break Down Data Silos and Analyze Across All Your Data with Amazon Redshift Data Sharing
description:
Data that you need for insights is not just growing in volume, but also getting more diverse (log data, click stream, voice, video). It often sits in various data silos, even third party organizations. Users across departments, organizations and regions expect to work on transactionally consistent data; however the process of transforming the data across these silos is fraught with issues like data duplication and loss, inconsistencies, inaccuracies, delay as data moves and network bottlenecks. Amazon Redshift provides deep integration into the AWS data ecosystem, across data lakes and purpose built data stores, and delivers on data sharing capabilities. Learn how to cut down your time to insights to minutes, instead of weeks and months, with Amazon Redshift data sharing capabilities, how it works, and use cases we are seeing among our customers.

Learning Objectives: 
* Objective 1: Learn about Redshift's data sharing capabilities and become an expert in data sharing use cases, how to share and access live data in a secure way without data movement or data copying.
* Objective 2: Get an understanding of how Amazon Redshift helps you break through data silos and enable data sharing across regions and accounts.
* Objective 3: Learn how the Amazon Redshift integration with AWS Data Exchange works and how you can find, subscribe to, and combine your first party data with third party data for application development, business dashboarding, and predictive analytics.

***To learn more about the services featured in this talk, please visit: https://aws.amazon.com/redshift Subscribe to AWS Online Tech Talks On AWS:

title: Democratizing Data Insights with Amazon QuickSight Embedded Dashboards - AWS Online Tech Talks
description:
Discover how you can bring data insights to the forefront for customers, partners, and internal teams, by seamlessly embedding rich, interactive data visualizations and dashboards into your web applications and portals. In this session, we’ll show you how to connect to your data from Amazon RDS, Amazon Athena, Amazon S3, Amazon Redshift and many others, and use the QuickSight API to tie it all together. Plus, we’ll share modern ways to allow users to interact with data using natural language search and ML to see root causes, consider forecasts, evaluate risks, and make well-informed, justifiable decisions.

* Objective 1: Learn how QuickSight embedded analytics can seamlessly integrate into custom applications and portals, creating data-driven differentiation for end users.
* Objective 2: Connect QuickSight to any data source, and use QuickSight APIs to display custom dashboards and visualizations.

title: What is SQL Server EOS and what are my cloud options?
description:
Microsoft SQL Server 2012 is coming to its end of support (EOS) on July 12, 2022. Microsoft will no longer provide patches or security updates after the EOS date, which may cause security and compliance issues and expose your applications to security risks.


In this video, we are going to talk about what is SQL Server EOS, what it means to your operations and how to manage it. We will walk you through the options AWS provides to help you migrate and modernize your SQL Server workloads.


Learning Objectives: 
* Objective 1: What is SQL Server end of support, and what it means to your operations.
* Objective 2: Why AWS is the best cloud to run and modernize SQL Server workloads.
* Objective 3: What options do you have when migrating and modernizing with AWS.

title: Run your Code With Less Effort - AWS Online Tech Talks
description:
AWS Lambda is a serverless compute service that runs your code in response to
events and automatically manages the underlying compute resources for you. In this demo, you will learn how to bootsrap a new project, configure your environment, create, deploy and run a sample serverless application with AWS Lambda. * Objective 2: Learn how to run code on high availability compute infrastructure and performs the administration functions of your compute resources.

caption: True

title: Amazon DocumentDB: Getting Started and Business Continuity Planning - AWS Virtual Workshop
description:
Engineered with enterprise JSON workloads in mind, Amazon DocumentDB (with MongoDB compatibility) is a scalable, highly durable, and fully managed database service for operating mission-critical MongoDB and JSON workloads.  This workshop will provide both educational content and expert-led labs focused on Amazon DocumentDB best practices.  During the educational content we will cover key use cases, differentiators, and how Amazon DocumentDB Global Clusters provides disaster recovery from region-wide outages and enables low-latency global reads.  During the lab portion of the event, you will gain hands-on experience getting started with Amazon DocumentDB and how to set up Global Clusters.

Learning Objectives: 
* Objective 1: Receive an introduction to Amazon DocumentDB including why document databases, use cases, the differences between DocumentDB and traditional databases, and the challenges scaling traditional databases.
* Objective 2: Gain hands-on experience getting started with Amazon DocumentDB during our introductory lab.
* Objective 3: Gain hands-on experience running globally distributed applications during our Global Clusters lab.

***To learn more about the services featured in this talk, please visit: https://aws.amazon.com/documentdb/ Subscribe to AWS Online Tech Talks On AWS:

title: Smart Buildings Episode 1: The road to digitalization: Cherokee County School District success story
description:
Cherokee County School District (CCSD) is 40 schools, 6000 employees and 42,000 students. CCSD’s maintenance staff were looking to unlock building data, increase energy and operational efficiency, and improve indoor air quality in school buildings to create a safe learning environment for returning K-12 students and staff. CCSD was looking for a solution that made it easy for teachers to control their indoor environment and gave students an opportunity to engage in hands-on learning with the school’s technical infrastructure to equip them with skills for work.

CCSD became an early adopter of Abound by Carrier, an AWS Partner. Carrier is the leading global provider of healthy, safe, sustainable, and intelligent building and cold chain solutions.

In this session, hear about CCSD’s journey to implementing Abound and the benefits they’ve seen in terms of reducing operational expenses and enhancing the indoor experience for staff and students. Attendees will gain an understanding of the school’s digital transformation journey, business outcomes, and next steps.

Learning Objectives: 
* Objective 1: Hear how Cherokee Country School District improved their operational efficiency
* Objective 2: Understand CCSD's digital transformation journey by diving into the smart building use case

title: Sustainability Impact: Driving Plant-Floor Action to Meet ESG Goals - AWS Online Tech Talks
description:
Customers, legislators, and investors are demanding manufacturers prioritize the environments and communities they operate within and depend upon. Companies are responding by setting transformative ESG goals, but the path to operationalization is often unclear. GE Digital offers AWS-enabled lean software solutions which customers are using to optimize production efficiency, reduce energy and water consumption, and lower variable industrial costs. By bridging these capabilities, manufacturers can translate their ESG goals into concrete plant-floor actions. Learn how GE Digital is actively innovating new lean circularity and sustainability solutions to help customers deconstruct their sustainability visions into the processes, routines, and action plans needed within their factories to arrive there. Join this engaging discussion to understand how GE Digital and AWS are supporting manufacturers on their journey to unlock competitive advantage for their business as they build a better world.

Learning Objectives: 
* Objective 1: Learn how to move from ESG goals to action.
* Objective 2: Understand how to generate real cost savings from ESG initiatives.
* Objective 3: Discover how customers are leveraging GE Digital Solutions and AWS to support manufacturing ESG outcomes.

description:

#AWS
caption: True

title: Smart Manufacturing Episode #4: Bridge the OT-IT Gap for DataOps at the Edge - AWS Online Tech Talks
description:
Cloud services have become a key component of digital transformation because of their ability to store, process, and analyze large amounts of data in a centralized location. However, integrating industrial data with enterprise systems in the Cloud has proved to be challenging for many industrials. Bridging the OT-IT gap requires a solution that can merge real-time, transactional, and time-series data into a single payload, model and contextualize this data, exchange information with Cloud services, and deliver an agile architecture. Bridging the OT-IT gap requires an Edge-native DataOps approach. In this session, HighByte, an AWS Partner, will share 4 real-world use cases of industrial companies who have used a DataOps approach to achieve multi-system integration, high-resolution data analytics, multi-site monitoring, and Cloud-to-Edge execution. Attendees will gain an understanding of data modeling and architectural best practices through these 4 use cases.

Learning Objectives: 
* Objective 1: Understand the fundamentals of Industrial DataOps and the benefits this approach provide.
* Objective 2: Learn how to collect and transform industrial data from various sources, including PI System, and prepare this data for analytics on AWS .
* Objective 3: Learn how to maintain system integrations throughout the life of the factory without writing code.

***To learn more about the services featured in this talk, please visit: https://aws.amazon.com/industrial/

title: Amazon DocumentDB Feature Launches: DML Query Auditing and Decimal128 - AWS Online Tech Talks
description:
Developers are leveraging JSON and document databases because the flexible, semi-structured, and hierarchical nature of documents allows them to evolve with applications’ needs. We built Amazon DocumentDB (with MongoDB compatibility) because enterprise customers wanted to manage their JSON workloads at scale. In this session, we will introduce our newest Amazon DocumentDB features, DML (Data Manipulation Language) query auditing and Decimal128, plus we will cover how new users can get started for free!

Learning Objectives: 
* Objective 1: Learn about DML query auditing and how it enables customers to audit INSERT, DELETE, UPDATE, and READ queries on their cluster.
* Objective 2: Learn about Decimal128 and how it allows customers to use decimal data with Amazon DocumentDB.
* Objective 3: Learn how to get started with the service for free with our new free tier offering.

title: Analytics Workshop: Enabling Agility with Data Governance on AWS- AWS Virtual Workshop
description:
Data governance is the process of managing data throughout this end-to-end process, ensuring its accuracy and completeness, and making sure it is accessible to those who need it. Learn how AWS is delivering comprehensive data governance - from data preparation and integration, to data access, data quality, and metadata management across our analytics services. See how you can build a solution for these common challenges and learn how to start applying these capabilities today.

Learning Objectives: 
* Objective 1:  Learn about AWS services that enable stronger data governance.
* Objective 2:  Understand how to address common challenges around data governance.
* Objective 3:  Review new capabilities in AWS Glue, AWS Lake Formation, and other services to enable data governance in your solutions.

caption: True

title: Building an extension with Trusted Language Extensions for PostgreSQL- AWS Virtual Workshop
description:
PostgreSQL’s extensible architecture is one of its superpowers, allowing people to plug in additional capabilities to meet their needs. However, building those extensions and deploying them to production is complex and can lead to instability issues for the first-time extension developer. The open-source project Trusted Language Extensions for PostgreSQL provides a new programming framework and runtime model for extensions to PostgreSQL where developers can add extensions to their database with simple SQL commands similar to PL/pgSQL and PL/Perl extensions. In this session, dig into the architecture of Trusted Language Extensions for PostgreSQL and learn how to safely add new capabilities to PostgreSQL.

Learning Objectives: 
* Objective 1: You will learn about the Trusted Language Extensions (TLE) for PostgreSQL open source project.
* Objective 2: You will learn how to safely add new extensions to your PostgreSQL database using TLE.
* Objective 3: You will learn about best practices for contributing to the project.

***To learn more about the services featured in this talk, please visit: https://github.com/aws/pg_tle
To download the slides visit:  https://pages.awscloud.com/rs/112-TZM-766/images/2023_0210-VW-DAT_Slide-Deck.pdf

title: Analytics in 15: Don’t Create More Data Silos! Use CDC and Data Streaming- AWS Analytics in 15
description:
A microservices architecture makes applications quicker to develop and easier to scale, enabling innovation and accelerating time to market for new features. However, this approach causes data to live in different silos, making it difficult to perform analytics. By building fully scalable pipelines to capture Change Data (CDC) and streaming them to your data lake, you can gain deeper insights from all your data being in one place.

Learning Objectives: 
* Objective 1: Learn more about the concept of Change Data Capture (CDC).
* Objective 2: Understand the benefits of CDC over traditional batch ETL.
* Objective 3: See how you can implement CDC systems at a scale using AWS streaming services.

title: Analytics in 15: Ingest, Manage, and Analyze Data with Central Governance- AWS Analytics in 15
description:
If your organization shares data, especially in large scale environments with multiple producer and consumer clusters, this is a session you don't want to miss! Within 15 minutes, you will learn how Amazon Redshift can help you ingest streaming data, auto-copy data from S3, and centrally manage data across multiple data shares – all without manual scripting or complex querying.

Learning Objectives: 
* Objective 1: See how data sharing access control with AWS Lake Formation works in action.
* Objective 2: Learn how to centrally manage granular access to data across all consuming data services.
* Objective 3: Understand how Amazon Redshift, Amazon S3,  AWS Lake Formation and AWS streaming services work together to help you ingest, manage and analyze data.

***To learn more about the services featured in this talk, please visit: https://aws.amazon.com/redshift/
****To download a copy of the slide deck from this webinar visit: https://pages.awscloud.com/Analytics-in-15-Ingest-Manage-and-Analyze-Data-with-Central-Governance_2023_SN-0403-ABD_OD Subscribe to AWS Online Tech Talks On AWS:
