title: DeepSeek facts vs hype, model distillation, and open source competition
description:
Learn more about artificial intelligence →  https://ibm.biz/BdGKri

Let’s bust some early myths about DeepSeek. In episode 40 of Mixture of Experts, join host Tim Hwang along with experts Aaron Baughman, Chris Hay and Kate Soule. Last week, we covered the release of DeepSeek-R1; now that the entire world is up to speed, let’s separate the facts from the hype. Next, what is model distillation and why does it matter for competition in AI? Finally, Sam Altman among other tech CEOs shared his response to DeepSeek. title: AJPBiz helps scale its customers' business operations with IBM Cloud
description:
Check out IBM Cloud Bare Metal Server solutions: http://ibm.biz/bare-metal-solutions
Check out IBM Cloud Virtual Server solutions: http://ibm.biz/virtual-server-solutions

AJP Business Pte Ltd (AJPBiz)—an internet service provider—seeks to deliver powerful and reliable connectivity to secure network solutions that help enterprises propel their business performance and productivity. AJPBiz’s heavy workloads required a secure server that could scale on demand and meet changing business needs, which resulted in the company partnering with IBM in 2012 to leverage bare metal and virtual servers.

title: Flexibly driving high scale apps in production with Kubernetes
description:
Learn more with free Kubernetes Guide: http://ibm.biz/free-kubernetes-guide
Check out free Containers Guide: http://ibm.biz/free-containers-guide

Learn more about Red Hat OpenShift on IBM Cloud: http://ibm.biz/openshift-ibm-cloud
Checkout IBM Cloud's Managed Kubernetes Service: http://ibm.biz/ibm-cloud-kubernetes-service

As part of their migration from VMs to containerized apps, The Weather Company setup an OpenShift/Kubernetes deployment in another vendor's cloud. From the OpenShift implementation, they migrated the container repository and the entire Kubernetes deployment configuration to IBM Cloud Kubernetes Service. This video focuses on key aspects of their migration that highlight the interoperability of OpenShift and IKS as Kubernetes platforms, resulting in a more secure and more customer-centric DevOps practices.

Get started on IBM Cloud at no cost: http://ibm.biz/start-on-ibm-cloud-for-free

title: IBM Cloud Object Storage: Built for business
description:
For more information got to https://www.ibm.com/cloud/object-storage
Companies today need the ability to easily and securely collect, store and analyze their data at a massive scale. IBM Cloud Object Storage is built to store any amount of data and retrieve it from anywhere on the web. It is designed to deliver 99.999999 percent durability, provide comprehensive security capabilities, and offer flexibility in the way you manage data for cost optimization and access control. Native integration of Aspera high-speed transfer enables you to easily move data into the cloud and query-in-place functionality lets you directly and instantly analyze large amounts of data using ANSI SQL.

title: IBM Keynote at Virtual AI Summit London 2020
description:
Learn more about IBM Cloud: https://ibm.biz/ibm-cloud-mainpage

Now more than ever, customers are relying on digital interactions with businesses, expecting them to be seamless and secure. Businesses in every single industry are working quickly to develop new and expanded ways to digitally engage with their customers while accelerating their shift to the cloud. As enterprises grapple with modernizing operations, the benefits of their digital transformation must be balanced by the certainty that it will bring sustainable value. 

Howard Boville, Senior Vice President, IBM Cloud, recently discussed how a strong architecture strategy and deep industry expertise are critical to your hybrid cloud journey and digital transformation success at the AI Summit London 2020 event. 

During the event he also addresses key questions around why an open architecture matters as businesses embark on their digital journey and why hybrid cloud matters to bridge the gap between the new world of cloud and traditional technology investments.

title: Data Warehousing and Beyond with Netezza Performance Server
description:
Learn more about Netezza Performance Server: http://ibm.biz/netezza-performance-server
Check out IBM Cloud Pak for Data: http://ibm.biz/prod-cloud-pak-for-data
Read the free Netezza solution brief: http://ibm.biz/netezza-performance-for-ibm-cloud-pak-for-data-solution-brief 
Get to know Netezza environment with virtual lab: http://ibm.biz/netezza-virtual-lab
Join the IBM Hybrid Data Management Community: http://ibm.biz/ibm-hybrid-data-management-community

►  Earn a badge with FREE interactive, browser-based Kubernetes labs: http://ibm.biz/no-cost-interactive-k8-tutorials

It’s been a little more than a year since we launched Netezza Performance Server, and it’s easy to see that our clients agree it has been a significant success. Just like all of the Netezza offerings before it, Netezza Performance Server has speed and simplicity at the very core of its design. Netezza Performance Server has proven to be even faster and simpler to use than before – and now sits on a cloud-native, containerized platform -RedHat OpenShift®. This design allows for a scalable, in-place expandable architecture and is available on-prem and on any cloud.

Netezza Performance Server being part of IBM Cloud Pak for Data, consolidates all analytical activity into one place, meaning it’s ready to deliver business-ready data for smart analytics and data science, right where the data resides.

Join us on this webinar as we share the latest on Netezza Performance Server, including the recent additions we have made specifically to help clients reduce costs while creating a data warehousing strategy for today’s needs and beyond.

Karmen Leung – Hybrid Data Management Global Sales Executive, IBM
Vikram Murali – VP of Development, Hybrid Data Management, IBM
Michael Roney – North America Data Warehouse Sales Executive, IBM

Get started on IBM Cloud for free: http://ibm.biz/start-free-cloud-account-reg

title: IBM Cloud Paks: AI-Powered Software to Advance Digital Transformation
description:
Check out IBM Cloud Paks → http://ibm.biz/ai-powered-ibm-cloud-paks 

IBM Cloud® Paks are AI-powered software for hybrid cloud that are designed to help you advance digital transformation with prediction, security, automation and modernization. IBM Cloud Paks are built on Red Hat® OpenShift®, letting you develop applications once and deploy them anywhere on any cloud. You can also integrate security across the breadth of your IT estate and automate your operations with management visibility.

Whether you are modernizing, integrating, or extending applications and data across your environment, IBM Cloud Paks can help you change how your business works, how you work, and most importantly, how you serve your customers.

title: IBM partners with NASA to develop Edge Computing in space aboard the ISS
description:
Read the blog to learn more about the project → https://ibm.biz/edge-computing-in-space-blog
Learn more about Edge Computing → http://ibm.biz/edge-computing-explained
Learn more about Containerization → http://ibm.biz/learn-containerization

Explore other IBM Cloud Solutions → http://ibm.biz/explore-ibm-cloud-products
Earn a badge with FREE interactive Kubernetes labs → http://ibm.biz/interactive-kube-labs

From the earliest days of Apollo when NASA landed the first humans on the moon, IBM has had the distinct honor of playing a key role in NASA's space exploration efforts. 

Fast forward 50 years to today and IBM is still innovating in space. Through a partnership with NASA, ISS National Lab, HPE, and Red Hat, IBM has developed an edge computing and space solution that eliminates the need to move massive libraries of DNA sequencing data by providing containerized analytical code locally right on the ISS where the data originates.

Get started on IBM Cloud at no cost → http://ibm.biz/get-started-with-free-cloud-acct
Subscribe to see more videos like this in the future → http://ibm.biz/subscribe-now​​​​

title: Ensuring AI is fair and unbiased for natural language processing
description:
Learn more about WatsonX: https://ibm.biz/BdPuQF

Natural Language Processing (NLP) is becoming a pervasive part of everyday life and is a form of AI-driven technology that many businesses and consumers rely on. However, if Natural Language Processing models, or any AI model for that matter, are not properly trained it can result in biased, unfair and inaccurate outcomes.

IBM’s Chief AI Officer, Seth Dobrin walks us through how to ensure AI is ethical, fair, and explainable–and why it is so critical to successfully deploying AI.

►  To learn more about how to successfully deploy AI, visit the IBM AI Training Ground → http://ibm.biz/overcome-your-ai-obstacles

title: Secure App Transactions and Sensitive Data with Cryptographic Key Encryption Protection
description:

Check out IBM Cloud Hyper Protect DBaaS → http://ibm.biz/hyper-protect-dbaas

In this video, Chris Poole with IBM, demonstrates how to deploy a secured virtual server, create a lockdown database, create an instance of IBM Cloud Hyper Protect Crypto Service and initialize its Hardware Security Module (HSM) using IBM Cloud Hyper Protect Services to ensure your data stay confidential.

Chapters
0:00 - Intro to Confidential Computing
0:50 - Secure your keys with HSM
1:20 - IBM Cloud Hyper Protect Crypto Services
1:40 - Keep Your Own Key (KYOK) & Key Ceremony
2:19 - Key Ceremony with a Smart Card
2:44 - Using Smart Cards to initialize HSM
3:42 - Create a lockdown database with IBM Cloud Hyper Protect DBaaS
4:31 - Deploy a secure virtual server with IBM Cloud Hyper Protect Virtual Servers
5:01 - Create an instance of the IBM Cloud Hyper Protect Crypto Service and initialize its HSM
6:00 - Summary

title: Managing IT Complex Environments
description:
Get the guide→ https://ibm.biz/BdmGrU
Learn more about the tech → https://ibm.biz/BdmGrt

Pets Vs. Cattle is a powerful concept in the IT space. Pets require love, constant attention, have deep  meaning, and can't just be replaced. While cattle are fungible. In DevOps and in particular application modernization, it's important not to confuse your pets from your cattle and now when a project requires that hands on constant attention or when it's best to leave it up to the herd.

title: Use generative AI to help save people from screaming “representative”
description:
AI in Action has moved to a new channel! Head over to @IBM to catch all the latest episodes and don't forget to subscribe so you never miss out! See you there!

AI news is moving fast. Keep your business ahead with updates about AI advancements, strategies and expert perspectives. → https://ibm.biz/BdKPKL

Do you really need a human on the line, or do you just need to give virtual agents a chance? Listen to host Albert Lawrence, Jeannie Walters, customer experience speaker and trainer, and Morgan Carroll, Senior AI engineer at IBM, dive into how generative AI is making human and virtual agents better at their job. The future of customer service is personalized, pro-active, and even empathetic.

title: Leaders v. learners: It all comes down to AI accessibility with Reshma Saujani
description:
AI in Action has moved to a new channel! Head over to @IBM to catch all the latest episodes and don't forget to subscribe so you never miss out! See you there!

There's a vanguard leading the charge to make AI accessible to all, and others are still catching up. Yet, amidst this progress, a concerning reality exists: a gender gap is forming in the field of AI. As much as we talk about reducing AI bias and promoting AI diversity, women and lower income populations are being left out, avoiding AI or in some cases using it without knowing they are. The good news is, it’s not too late. Listen to Reshma Saujani, Founder & CEO of Girls Who Code, talk about “aspirational AI” and what we can do to close the gap

Is o1 Pro worth the cost? In Episode 33 of Mixture of Experts, host Tim Hwang is joined by Marina Danilevsky, Kate Soule and Vyoma Gajjar. First, the experts debrief the 12 Days of OpenAI. Next, we review some of the top papers in NeurIPS, how are the experts keeping up with all these research papers? Then, we are back with another benchmark, can ARC Prize make AGI more tractable? Finally, Meta announced the launch of Llama 3.3 70B with the promise of 405B performance, can we have our cake and eat it too? Find out more on today’s Mixture of Experts!

title: NY Tech Week, open source AI reports and Claude 4 behaviors
description:
Subscribe for AI updates → https://ibm.biz/BdnuK4

Is open source winning the AI race? In episode 58 of Mixture of Experts, host Tim Hwang is joined by Anthony Annunziata, Ash Minhas and Sarah Amos live from New York Tech Week. First, we dive into the various themes coming out of NY Tech Week, specifically practical uses of AI. Next, we analyze a couple of different reports about the impact of open source on AI. Finally, Claude 4 has some really weird behaviors. What does this teach us about AI safety and model development? All that and more on this week’s Mixture of Experts.

title: Apple’s WWDC, Meta & Scale AI, o3-pro and fault-tolerant quantum computing
description:
How IBM will build the world's first large-scale, fault-tolerant quantum computer: https://ibm.biz/BdnQdD

Did Apple’s WWDC 2025 live up to expectations? In episode 59 of Mixture of Experts, host Tim Hwang is joined by Chris Hay, Kaoutar El Magrahoui and Shobhit Varshney. Today, the experts analyze all things Apple—from Apple Research’s recent paper “The Illusion of Thinking” to Apple Intelligence. Next, OpenAI released o3-pro: we continue the analysis on AI reasoning. Then, Meta purchased Scale AI for a whopping $15 billion. Why? Finally, an exciting new announcement on fault-tolerant quantum computing: IBM Quantum Starling will arrive by 2029. What does this mean and why should we care? All that and more on this week’s Mixture of Experts.

title: Perplexity’s Comet browser, Cloudflare blocks AI scrapers and Wimbledon Match Chat
description:
Subscribe for AI updates →  https://ibm.biz/Bdex8z

How will AI agents change search? In episode 63 of Mixture of Experts, host Tim Hwang is joined by Aaron Baughman, Chris Hay and Kate Soule. First, Perplexity released their Comet browser, and there are rumors that OpenAI is next. Who will win the AI browser war? Then, we discuss frontier model transparency amid Anthropic’s call for a “targeted transparency framework”. Does this only support large model developers? Later, Cloudflare blocks AI scrapers. Is this a good thing? Finally, we discuss how AI is showing up at Wimbledon this year and enhancing the fan experience via Match Chat.  Tune in to today’s episode of Mixture of Experts.
